awd_titl_txt: Microbial Exchanges and Couplings in Coastal Atlantic       Systems:  Biological Programs
awd_abstract_narration: This is a one year conclusion of a large three year                        interdisciplinary field study of the Chesapeake Bay and adjoining               coastal area.  During the initial funding period, four scientific               cruises collected a wealth of data on the nutrient recycling and                microbiology of this coupled estuarine - coastal system.  This                  work offers the most detailed picture yet of the role of marine                 bacteria and phytoplankton in the assimilative capacity of a                    coastal region impacted by large population centers.  This                      funding will allow the collaborative scientists to add additional               results to their existing base, and produce scientific                          publications integrating this novel collection of measurements in               the coastal environment.
